Description: Shoulder of carinated pottery storage jar or transport amphora. Wheel-made. Fine orange fabric with abundant small mica, common fine white and black inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Probably a Chian jar, and perhaps from same amphora as Cambridge, Museum of Classical Archaeology NA743.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JA.043)
